result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Lenard R Zettle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time work, school or combination of the two.
To commit no further criminal acts during the period of the agreement.

Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted.  This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment. Comply with any and all rules and conditions of probation in a timely fashion and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as a part of this case.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: $1000 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Court has no objection to jail time being broken up. This to be worked out with the jail. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: to Dismiss Ct. 1
Order to Dismiss Ct. 1
Motion to Dismiss Ct. 1

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DC Jail request for sentence modification - Defendant requests to to split sentence, needs to resume work to pay bills.  Court responds - allowed you out on a funeral furlough. You decided to use cocaine. Actions have consequences. DTE
Door County Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant requests his sentence be split so he can resume working and pay his bill. Court denies request.
Door County Jail Petition for Sentence Modification - Court revokes huber/work release for the remainder of the inmate's incarceration.

DC Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant Lenard requests furlough for he and Suzanne to attend his mother's funeral and to take care of family matters. Court approves request. Can work out with jail the length of the furlough. DTE
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Lenard R. Zettle in court with attorney Randall Petrouske.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 3 to Misd. Possession of THC,  gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and amended Ct. 3.   Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 3 and Ct. 2 as charged. Court withholds acceptance of the plea on Ct. 1 to allow defendant time to complete terms of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement. Upon successful completion of DAGPA, State will, after 2 years, move to dismiss Ct. 1 and matter can be disposed by written stipulation.  Court reviews collateral consequences if defendant should be convicted of a felony, possible penalties. Court reviews DAGPA with defendant, approves and signs agreement. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond remains in effect regarding Ct. 1.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 11:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 04:00 pm
from Atty Petrouske advising defendant has accepted the State's offer and intends to enter a plea on 2/29/16.

Attorneys Randall Walter Petrouske and Larry Vesely appear by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews Atty Petrouske's motion to adjourn trial and motions by both attorneys to consolidate trial of Lenard and Suzanne Zettle.  Court grants motion to adjourn trial on 2/17/16.   State gives argument on motion to join trials of Lenard and Suzanne Zettle, feels motion should be denied and each defendant tried separately. Atty Petrouske responds. Atty Vesely responds. Atty Pelrine gives final argument. Court denies motion of each defendant for a joinder of cases at trial. Court will reschedule trial. (JA to contact Atty Petrouske to reschedule trial)
Defendant's Motion for Joinder
Defendant's Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial
Motion hearing at 02-15-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Lenard R Zettle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, indicates this matter is still in the #2 position for trial. Court reviews Atty Petrouske's request to consolidate this matter with Suzanne Zettle's case. State hasn't seen a motion from either party to join matters, feels each matter should proceed on their own.  Atty Petrouske responds, feels his brief is a request to join this case with Suzanne Zettle's case.  Atty Petrouske asks court to set a hearing with all parties including Atty Vesely to hear this matter. DA Pelrine responds.  Court won't take up motion until a written motion to join is filed by either Atty Vesely or Atty Petrouske, trial remains on the calendar at this point. Atty Petrouske recently received new information from his client, requests adjournment of the 2/17/16. Court advises Atty Petrouske to file written motion with the court. Court questions Atty Petrouske if he would be available to try case on 3/08/16 if motion to join is granted. Atty Petrouske does have that date open. Court will have JA set aside 3/09/16 also if civil case goes away as an extra day in this matter. Bond remains in effect.
in letter form from Atty Petrouske to oppose severance
from Atty Petrouske requesting adjournment of 2/01/16 pretrial.
from Atty Petrouske asking court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Court grants request.
Jury trial at 02-17-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 02-01-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Lenard R Zettle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Petrouske to adjourn Arriaignment. State has no objection to adjournment.  Court reschedules.
Arraignment at 09-24-2015 09:15 am
State Exh. 1 - portion of Inv. Stenzel's report. Offered and received.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Lenard R Zettle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken from Inv. Jason Stenzel, sworn.  State Exh. 1 - portion of report by Inv. Jason Stenzel. Offered and received. Cross. Redirect. Recross. Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and probable cause that defendant committed that felony and binds over for further proceedings.  Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/29/15 by jail staff.
Preliminary hearing at 07-28-2015 09:00 am

No contact direct or indirect with G.P..   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Lenard R Zettle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. 30 - 45 day out. Bond set.
from Atty Petrouske asking to reschedule 6/15/15 hearing because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Initial appearance at 06-29-2015 10:00 am

Attorney Larry Vesely accepts service of the Summons and Complaint on behalf of defendant.  (per email from Sally B. in the DA's office)
